results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.markdown_table_response:
The decrease in capital expenditures at Bell Media reflects the following:
• The elimination of the three-year management contract, which is expected to end in mid-2019
• The completion of the purchase of the majority of Bell Media's assets from existing shareholders, including a new holding company, as well as the sale of Bell Media's wireless assets to a new company
• The completion of the sale of Bell Media's assets to a new holding company, including a new television and data-fibre business
• The completion of the merger of Bell Media's wireless and wireline businesses, with the creation of a new wireless business and a new wireline business
results.csv_string_response:
The decline in capital expenditures was primarily driven by the following:
• The improvement of the customer experience at Bell Media, where we delivered a higher level of customer satisfaction, better customer service, a reduction in the number of complaints, and a more collaborative business model, which positively impacted our customers' satisfaction, as well as the bottom line
• The improvement of the commercial offerings in Bell Media, with the integration of the television service into our business model
• The reduction of our capital expenditures in the wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, reflecting the roll-out of the fixed WTTP network and the improvement of our business customer contracts
• The improvement of the performance of our wireless network, including the deployment of 5G and the roll-out of our 5G infrastructure
